info.title: SECOM MES Database API
info.description:
REST API for SECOM Manufacturing Execution System Database

This API provides access to semiconductor manufacturing data including:
- Master data (Equipment, Shifts, Operators, Product Types, Features)
- Production data (Lots, Measurements, Quality Results)
- Analytics (Production summaries, Equipment health, Shift performance, Quality analytics)

**Database**: MariaDB 11.2
**Total Records**: 1,567 lots with 590 sensor measurements each
**Time Period**: July 2008 - September 2008

**Key Endpoints**:
- `/equipment` - Manufacturing equipment management
- `/lots` - Production lot tracking with filters
- `/measurements` - Sensor measurement data
- `/quality` - Quality inspection results
- `/analytics` - Analytics and reporting endpoints

tags.name: Analytics
tags.description: Analytics and reporting endpoints using database views

get.description: Returns a single shift by shift ID
Returns a single quality result by quality result ID
Returns a single product type by product type ID

put.description: Updates an existing product type record

get.description: Returns a single operator by operator ID
Returns a single lot by lot ID
Returns a single feature metadata by feature ID

put.description: Updates an existing feature metadata record

get.description: Returns a single equipment by equipment ID
Returns list of all work shifts
Returns paginated list of all quality inspection results

post.description: Creates a new quality inspection result

get.description: Returns list of all product types

post.description: Creates a new product type record

get.description: Returns list of all production operators

post.description: Creates a new lot measurement record

get.description: Returns paginated list of lots with optional filters for equipment, operator, status, and date range

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status filter (in_progress, completed, quality_hold, released, scrapped)

post.description: Creates a new production lot record

get.description: Returns paginated list of all feature metadata (590 features)

post.description: Creates a new feature metadata record

get.description: Returns list of all manufacturing equipment
Returns shift by unique shift code (DAY, SWING, NIGHT)
Returns all lots that passed quality inspection (classification = -1)

get.summary: Get quality result for a lot
get.description: Returns quality result for a specific lot
Returns lots with predicted risk above threshold (default 0.7)
Returns all lots that failed quality inspection (classification = 1)
Returns quality results filtered by defect type (electrical_fail, dimensional_oor, etc.)
Returns all product types in a specific family (Logic, Memory, Analog)
Returns product type by unique product code
Returns all lots processed by a specific operator
Returns all operators in a specific department
Returns operator by unique operator code
Returns all sensor measurements for a specific lot (typically 590 measurements)

get.summary: Get out-of-spec measurements for a lot
get.description: Returns only measurements that are outside normal specification ranges
Returns all measurements for a specific sensor/feature across all lots
Returns paginated list of all measurements outside normal specification ranges
Returns lot by unique lot number
Search features by name or category
Returns all features marked as critical quality parameters
Returns feature metadata by unique feature code (F0-F589)
Returns all features in a specific category (CVD_Process, Etch_Process, etc.)
Returns all equipment of a specific type (CVD, Etcher, etc.)
Returns equipment by unique equipment code
Returns overall production KPIs from production_summary view
Returns performance metrics by shift from shift_performance_comparison view
Returns histogram of predicted risk scores
Returns defect type breakdown from quality_analytics_summary view
Returns lots with predicted risk above specified threshold with detailed information
Returns top features by importance score for a specific defect type or overall
Returns health metrics for all equipment from equipment_health_stats view
Returns distribution of defect types across failed lots
